intro: Scutia myrtina var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf scutia, is a species native to the southern United States. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its elliptical, often narrow leaves that are typically arranged oppositely on the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the spring, which are followed by orange to red berries in the fall. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and ornamental horticulture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun to partial shade conditions.
